Authors:
Wassila Aigoun-Mouhous, Alla Eddine Mahamedi, Maela Léon,
Cherifa Chaouia, Abdelghani Zitouni, katerina Barankova, Ales Eichmeier,
Josep Armengol, David Gramaje, Akila Berraf-Tebbal
Title:
Cadophora sabaouae sp. nov. and Phaeoacremonium species
associated with Petri disease on grapevine propagation material and
young grapevines in Algeria
Keywords:
nurseries, young grapevines, Cadophora, Phaeoacremonium,
Algeria
Abstract:
A field survey conducted on asymptomatic grapevine
propagation material from nurseries and symptomatic young grapevines
throughout different regions of Algeria yielded a collection of 70
Phaeoacremonium-like isolates and three Cadophora-like isolates. Based
on morphology and DNA sequence data of β-tubulin (tub2) and actin (act),
five Phaeoacremonium species were identified including Phaeoacremonium
minimum (22 isolates), P. venezuelense (19 isolates), P. parasiticum (17
isolates), P. australiense (8 isolates) and P. iranianum (4 isolates).
The latter two species (P. australiense and P. iranianum) were reported
for the first time in Algeria. Multi-locus phylogenetic analyses (ITS,
tub2, tef1) and morphological features, allowed the description of the
three isolates belonging to the genus Cadophora (WAMC34, WAMC117 and
WAMC118) as a novel species, namely Cadophora sabaouae sp. nov. All the
identified species were pathogenic on grapevine cuttings.
